channel.title: NPC spawn
channel.description:
I'm looking for a command I can use to spawn an NPC of a certain type. So if I type in '::rule1' it will spawn a man (that will later shout out "stop breaking rule 1!"). Any ideas?
Many thanks,
Syrillia.

item.title: NPC spawn
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

OK guys, just clear everything up. My NPC spawn works fine. The NPC spawns and it wanders around just like I wanted it to. That’s to J-K for that. The only thing is, the NPC doesn’t talk. This is what I added for it, exactly;

if (npcs[i].npcType == 90) {
if (misc.random2(20) == 1) {
npcs[i].updateRequired = true;
npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true;
npcs[i].textUpdate = "Don't break rule 1: No attack non-combat NPC's!";
}

It doesn’t talk. I just wanders around. Does anyone know why. My threads always become hate threads.

Read full topic

item.title: NPC spawn
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:18, topic:159281”]Lel @ at you all;

I love you too. :P. Dont worry about it. I’ve added it, no errors, except one!

When the I spawn the npc, it doesn’t talk. It just walks around. I’ve tried changing the 50 to 20 and 1 and 15 and everything, it just doesn’t change. Any help?

BTW why you love me?

Maybe because you’re calling the method that is called in the update() method? Thus every 500s your addition with your command is not parsed.
Try calling a method within your command, like;
else if(command.startsWith(“blah”)) {
String leleleel = command.substring(4);
server.npcHandler.makeNPC(leleleel, absX, (absY + 0), heightLevel, absX + 10, absY + 10, absX + -10, absY + -10, 1, server.npcHandler.GetNpcListHP(newNPC), false);
}

Then, in class NPCHandler add a method to store it in an ArrayList/Array, thus in the newNPC() method make it read the ArrayList?

(There is other ways too).[/quote]

And basically thats what ::npc does… And he asked for, a command to spawn npc, which is what i gave him. And how to make the npc speak… . .

Read full topic

item.title: NPC spawn
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

Wtf are u on zilchuary… ReplaceObject, wtf… And stop spamming his topic… Proves how immature you are, what have you been taking? Skittles? … -.-

Syrillia, search for “moo”… You should see something like…

					if (npcs[i].npcType == 397 || npcs[i].npcType == 1766 || npcs[i].npcType == 1767 || npcs[i].npcType == 1768) {
						if (misc.random2(50) == 1) {
							npcs[i].updateRequired = true;
							npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true;
							npcs[i].textUpdate = "Moo";
						}
					}

You can use that format, or this format… Which will make an npc speak on certain coords.

					if (npcs[i].npcType == 0 && npcs[i].absX == #### && npcs[i].absY == ####) {
						if (misc.random2(10) == 5) {
							npcs[i].updateRequired = true;
							npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true;
							npcs[i].textUpdate = "Txt here ;)";
						}
					}

The ####'s are the X and Y coord. H2H

Read full topic

item.title: NPC spawn
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

Well I just looked through my old TeleScape server… and came across this method. It isn’t a command, but it spawns a Zamorak Monk. The Monk then says “Feel my vengeance!” and attacks the closest player to it.

public void zammyMonkAttack() {
for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players)
{

client person = (client)p;
 	if(p != null && person != null) 
	{
	for(int I = 0; I < server.npcHandler.npcs.length; I++)
	{
		if((server.npcHandler.npcs[I] != null) && (server.npcHandler.npcs[I].npcType == 1044))
		{
			server.npcHandler.npcs[I].updateRequired = true;
			server.npcHandler.npcs[I].textUpdateRequired = true;
			server.npcHandler.npcs[I].textUpdate = "Feel my vengeance!";
    			server.npcHandler.npcs[I].StartKilling = playerId;
    			server.npcHandler.npcs[I].RandomWalk = false;
    			server.npcHandler.npcs[I].IsUnderAttack = true;
				}
			}
		}
	}
}

That should do after a little bit of editing.

Read full topic

item.title: NPC spawn
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“Syrillia, post:1, topic:159281”]I’m looking for a command I can use to spawn an NPC of a certain type. So if I type in ‘::rule1’ it will spawn a man (that will later shout out “stop breaking rule 1!”). Any ideas?

Many thanks,

Syrillia.[/quote]

Place this in the customCommand() method:

        else if (command.startsWith("npc")) {
                try 
					{
                    int newNPC = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(4));
                    if (newNPC >= 0)
						{
                        server.npcHandler.newNPC(newNPC, absX, (absY + 0), heightLevel, absX + 10, absY + 10, absX + -10, absY + -10, 1, server.npcHandler.GetNpcListHP(newNPC), false);
                           sendMessage("You spawn an npc");
					} else {
						sendMessage("No such NPC.");
					}
				} catch(Exception e) {
					sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::npc 1");
				}
			}

Read full topic
